Package zuul

Class Game

java.lang.Object
zuul.Game
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
The World of Zuul game engine. This stores the state of the game and handles overall flow of game logic.

The UserInterface should call Game.getInstance().play() to create the game and start the game logic.

This class holds a static instance of itself that stores the Map (game state) and Parser.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.Boolean finished
    Marker for if this Game should finish.
    private static Game gameInstance
    Static instance of zuul.Game class to ensure a single instance is active.
    private Map map
    The map to be used for this Game.
    private Parser parser
    The Parser to be used for this Game.

  • Field Details

    • gameInstance

      private static Game gameInstance
      Static instance of zuul.Game class to ensure a single instance is active.

    • map

      private final Map map
      The map to be used for this Game.

    • parser

      private final Parser parser
      The Parser to be used for this Game.

    • finished

      private java.lang.Boolean finished
      Marker for if this Game should finish.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      private Game()
      Creates the game and initialise its Map and Parser. This constructor is declared private to limit instantiation to a single static instance. To get the static instance call getInstance().

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Game getInstance()
      Gets the static instance of this class. An instance is created if it does not already exist.
      Returns:
      the static instance of Game, not null

    • play

      public void play()
      Starts main game flow. Loops until finish() is called.

      Each loop every character in the map is told to Character.act().

    • getParser

      public Parser getParser()
      Gets the Parser associated to this Game.
      Returns:
      the parser associated to this Game.

    • finish

      public void finish()
      Sets the finished marker to true.

      This will cause game logic to stop executing.
